result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. John J Oropeza

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Cases heard: 16CF52 & 16CM79, Defendant John J Oropeza in court, in custody with attorney Leonie Dolch.  Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Waiver of Preliminary Hearing filed. Court found probable cause, bound defendant over.  Reading waived on Information in 16CF52. Court went over the rights & elements. Defendant pled no contest to count 1 in 16CF52. Court found defendant guilty, entered judgment, sentence withheld, 2 yr. probation, Conds: 30 days jail start June 10, 2016 at 7 p.m. Huber granted under jail rules. $518 costs, submit DNA sample. Complete AODA and comply with all treatment recommendations. Maintain absolute sobriety. Complete anger management counseling. Cts. 2&3 dismissed. 16CM79 read in and dismissed. 68 jail credit.
Copy of Letter from ADA Chris Genda to Atty Leonie Dolch    re:  Discovery.
For Leave to File Additional Motions filed by Atty Genda
and Notice of DNA and Witness List filed by Atty Genda
records.descr: Notice of motion and motion for discovery

records.addlTxt: from Atty Genda to Atty Dolch re: discovery material
Pretrial 3-28-16 at 2:00 pm and Return date on 4-15-16 at 2:45 pm
standard misdemeanor conditions, no contact w/G.R.

Defendant John J Oropeza in court, in custody by video with attorney Tristan F Eagon.  Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin. waives reading of complaint, right to atty recited, 16 CM 79, $1,000.00 sign bond, standard misdemeanor conditions, no contact w/G.R., 16 CF 52, $4,000.00 cash bond, standard felony conditions, no contact w/J.T., not possess any weapons, not possess/consume alcoholic beverages, waives time limits to prelim,  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 28, 2016 at 02:00 pm.  Return date scheduled for April 15, 2016 at 02:45 pm.
